post.description: Create a new addon and add it to the collection of addons.

parameters.name: dryRun
parameters.description: DryRun indicates the request body will not be persisted when dryRun=true.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description:
Order criteria.

The syntax of this parameter is similar to the syntax of the _order by_ clause of
a SQL statement, but using the names of the attributes of the addon instead of
the names of the columns of a table. For example, in order to sort the addons
descending by name the value should be:

```sql
name desc
```

If the parameter isn't provided, or if the value is empty, then the order of the
results is undefined.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Index of the requested page, where one corresponds to the first page.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description:
Search criteria.

The syntax of this parameter is similar to the syntax of the _where_ clause of an
SQL statement, but using the names of the attributes of the addon instead of
the names of the columns of a table. For example, in order to retrieve all the
addons with a name starting with `my` the value should be:

```sql
name like 'my%'
```

If the parameter isn't provided, or if the value is empty, then all the addons
that the user has permission to see will be returned.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Maximum number of items that will be contained in the returned page.

page.description: Index of the requested page, where one corresponds to the first page.

size.description: Maximum number of items that will be contained in the returned page.

total.description:
Total number of items of the collection that match the search criteria,
regardless of the size of the page.

get.description: Retrieves the details of the addon.

parameters.name: dryRun
parameters.description: DryRun indicates the request body will not be persisted when dryRun=true.

post.description: Create a new addon version and add it to the collection of addons.

parameters.name: dryRun
parameters.description: DryRun indicates the request body will not be persisted when dryRun=true.

get.description: Retrieves the list of addon versions.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description:
Order criteria.

The syntax of this parameter is similar to the syntax of the _order by_ clause of
a SQL statement, but using the names of the attributes of the addon instead of
the names of the columns of a table. For example, in order to sort the addon
versions descending by id the value should be:

```sql
id desc
```

If the parameter isn't provided, or if the value is empty, then the order of the
results is undefined.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Index of the requested page, where one corresponds to the first page.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description:
Search criteria.

The syntax of this parameter is similar to the syntax of the _where_ clause of an
SQL statement, but using the names of the attributes of the addon version instead
of the names of the columns of a table. For example, in order to retrieve all the
addon versions with an id starting with `0.1` the value should be:

```sql
id like '0.1.%'
```

If the parameter isn't provided, or if the value is empty, then all the addon
versions that the user has permission to see will be returned.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Maximum number of items that will be contained in the returned page.

page.description: Index of the requested page, where one corresponds to the first page.

size.description: Maximum number of items that will be contained in the returned page.

total.description:
Total number of items of the collection that match the search criteria,
regardless of the size of the page.

Order criteria.

The syntax of this parameter is similar to the syntax of the _order by_ clause of
a SQL statement, but using the names of the attributes of the add-on instead of
the names of the columns of a table. For example, in order to sort the add-ons
descending by name the value should be:

```sql
name desc
```

If the parameter isn't provided, or if the value is empty, then the order of the
results is undefined.

parameters.name: page

Search criteria.

The syntax of this parameter is similar to the syntax of the _where_ clause of an
SQL statement, but using the names of the attributes of the add-on instead of
the names of the columns of a table. For example, in order to retrieve all the
add-ons with a name starting with `my` the value should be:

```sql
name like 'my%'
```

If the parameter isn't provided, or if the value is empty, then all the add-ons
that the user has permission to see will be returned.

post.description: Create a new addon status and add it to the collection of addons statuses.

get.description: Retrieves the list of addon statuses for a cluster.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description:
If the parameter isn't provided, or if the value is empty, then the order of the
results is undefined.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Index of the requested page, where one corresponds to the first page.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Maximum number of items that will be contained in the returned page.

items.description: Retrieved list of addon status conditions

page.description: Index of the requested page, where one corresponds to the first page.

size.description: Maximum number of items that will be contained in the returned page.

total.description: Total number of items of the collection regardless of the size of the page.

get.description: Retrieves the details of the addon version.

AdditionalCatalogSource.description: Representation of an addon catalog source object used by addon versions.

id.description: ID of the additional catalog source

enabled.description: Indicates is this additional catalog source is enabled for the addon

image.description: Image of the additional catalog source.

name.description: Name of the additional catalog source.

Addon.description: Representation of an addon that can be installed in a cluster.

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'Addon' if this is a complete object or 'AddonLink' if it is just a link.

config.description: Additional configs to be used by the addon once its installed in the cluster.

credentials_requests.description: List of credentials requests to authenticate operators to access cloud resources.

docs_link.description: Link to documentation about the addon.

enabled.description: Indicates if this addon can be added to clusters.

has_external_resources.description: Indicates if this addon has external resources associated with it

hidden.description: Indicates if this addon is hidden.

icon.description: Base64-encoded icon representing an addon. The icon should be in PNG format.

install_mode.description: The mode in which the addon is deployed.

label.description: Label used to attach to a cluster deployment when addon is installed.

managed_service.description: Indicates if addon is part of a managed service

namespaces.description: List of namespaces associated with this addon.

operator_name.description: The name of the operator installed by this addon.

parameters.description: List of parameters for this addon.

requirements.description: List of requirements for this addon.

resource_cost.description: Used to determine how many units of quota an addon consumes per resource name.

resource_name.description: Used to determine from where to reserve quota for this addon.

sub_operators.description: List of sub operators for this addon.

target_namespace.description: The namespace in which the addon CRD exists.

version.description: Link to the current default version of this addon.

AddonConfig.description:
Representation of an addon config.
The attributes under it are to be used by the addon once its installed in the cluster.

add_on_environment_variables.description: List of environment variables for the addon

add_on_secret_propagations.description: List of secret propagations for the addon

AddonEnvironmentVariable.description: Representation of an addon env object.

enabled.description: Indicates is this environment variable is enabled for the addon

AddonInstallMode.description: Representation of an addon InstallMode field.

AddonNamespace.description: Representation of an addon namespace object.

annotations.description: Annotations to be included in the addon namespace

enabled.description: Enabled shows if this namespace object is in use

labels.description: Labels to be included in the addon namespace

conditions.description: Conditions in which this parameter is valid for

default_value.description: Indicates the value default for the addon parameter.

editable.description: Indicates if this parameter can be edited after creation.

editable_direction.description:
Restricts if the parameter can be upscaled/downscaled
Expected values are "up", "down", or "" (no restriction).

enabled.description: Indicates if this parameter is enabled for the addon.

options.description: List of options for the addon parameter value.

required.description: Indicates if this parameter is required by the addon.

validation.description: Validation rule for the addon parameter.

validation_err_msg.description: Error message to return should the parameter be invalid.

value_type.description: Type of value of the addon parameter.

AddonParameterOption.description: Representation of an addon parameter option.

name.description: Name of the addon parameter option.

rank.description: Rank of option to be used in cases where editable direction should be restricted.

requirements.description: List of addon requirements for this parameter option.

value.description: Value of the addon parameter option.

AddonParameterValueType.description: Representation of the value type for this specific addon parameter

enabled.description: Indicates if this requirement is enabled for the addon.

resource.description: Type of resource of the addon requirement.

status.description: Optional cluster specific status for the addon.

AddonRequirementStatus.description: Representation of an addon requirement status.

error_msgs.description: Error messages detailing reasons for unfulfilled requirements.

fulfilled.description: Indicates if this requirement is fulfilled.

AddonSecretPropagation.description: Representation of an addon secret propagation

destination_secret.description: DestinationSecret is location of the secret to be added

enabled.description: Indicates is this secret propagation is enabled for the addon

source_secret.description: SourceSecret is location of the source secret

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'AddonStatus' if this is a complete object or 'AddonStatusLink' if it is just a link.

addon_id.description: ID of the addon whose status belongs to.

correlation_id.description: Identifier for co-relating current AddonCR revision and reported status.

status_conditions.description: List of reported addon status conditions

AddonStatusCondition.description: Representation of an addon status condition type.

status_type.description: Type of the reported addon status condition

status_value.description: Value of the reported addon status condition

AddonStatusConditionType.description: Representation of an addon status condition type field.

AddonStatusConditionValue.description: Representation of an addon status condition value field.

AddonSubOperator.description:
Representation of an addon sub operator. A sub operator is an operator
who's life cycle is controlled by the addon umbrella operator.

enabled.description: Indicates if the sub operator is enabled for the addon

operator_name.description: Name of the addon sub operator

operator_namespace.description: Namespace of the addon sub operator

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will be 'AddonVersion' if this is a complete object or 'AddonVersionLink' if it is just a link.

additional_catalog_sources.description: Additional catalog sources associated with this addon version

available_upgrades.description: AvailableUpgrades is the list of versions this version can be upgraded to.

channel.description: The specific addon catalog source channel of packages

config.description: Additional configs to be used by the addon once its installed in the cluster.

enabled.description: Indicates if this addon version can be added to clusters.

parameters.description: List of parameters for this addon version.

pull_secret_name.description: The pull secret name used for this addon version.

requirements.description: List of requirements for this addon version.

source_image.description: The catalog source image for this addon version.

sub_operators.description: List of sub operators for this addon version.

CredentialRequest.description: Contains the necessary attributes to allow each operator to access the necessary AWS resources

name.description: Name of the credentials secret used to access cloud resources

namespace.description: Namespace where the credentials secret lives in the cluster

policy_permissions.description: List of policy permissions needed to access cloud resources

service_account.description: Service account name to use when authenticating

kind.description: Indicates the type of this object. Will always be 'Error'

code.description: Globally unique code of the error, composed of the unique identifier of the API and the numeric identifier of the error. For example, for if the numeric identifier of the error is `93` and the identifier of the API is `clusters_mgmt` then the code will be `CLUSTERS-MGMT-93`.

reason.description: Human readable description of the error.
